content:
Configuring and Using the Transaction Component

The Transaction component list is supported for claims and assets (insurance policies). To use it, add the transaction component to the claims and asset detail pages, then associate it with an Integration Procedure.

Here's the workflow:

Customize Transaction Objects
Set Up a Transaction Component OmniForm
Set Up Transaction Component Post IPs and Integration Procedures
Add the Transaction Component to Pages

This OmniForm appears when you create a transaction in an asset or a claim. Go to OmniScript Designer and create a new OmniScript that you can use as an OmniForm.

Create two Integration Procedures for each object: a Post-Integration Procedure ("Post IP"), and an Integration Procedure that calls the Post IP.

In Vlocity Integration Procedures, enter:

* Name
* Type (Claim or Asset)
* SubType (Transaction)

Drag a Remote Action onto the Structure. Enter:

* Element Name
* Remote Class
* Remote Method

Drag an Omnistudio Data Mapper Post Action onto the Structure under the Remote Action.

Create a new Data Mapper and map the fields for the transaction component.

In Vlocity Integration Procedures, enter:

* Name
* Type (Claim or Asset)
* SubType (Transaction)

Drag an OmniForm action onto the Structure. Enter:

* Element Name
* Type
* Post IP

Add the Transaction Component to Pages by dragging and dropping the Vlocity Transactions List Component onto the detail page and specifying the Integration Procedure for this type of object.

Vlocity provides a Transactions object to support transaction component functionality.
title: Configuring and Using the Insurance Transaction Component
